question: A London branch of the All-India Muslim League was established in 1908 under the presidency of which of the following leaders?
explanation: Syed Ameer Ali established the London Muslim League in 1908. This organisation was an independent body and not a branch of All India Muslim League. In 1909, he became the first Indian to sit as a member of the Judicial Committee of the Privy Council on which he would serve till his death in 1928.
